instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage
threads.message:
This board came in with liquid damage all around the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>. Replaced components but in the middle of replacing <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> some minor pad damage happened on board see picture. Every time <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> is soldered amp meter cycles from balls bridging.

What is the best way to fix this? Does uv mask work if you apply in between the pads to prevent bridging? I have tried minor scraping in the area but the balls still bridge

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage
threads.message:
If these pads have common line (in pair), no problem if their balls make contact.
But probably when the solder get spreaded on the trace, lose contact between chip and pads.
